summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons inmate housing history report for Nicholas John Tartaglione, detailing his cell/bed assignments and transfers within the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) facilities in New York from December 2016 to September 2022. It shows his movement between different housing units, ranges, and beds over nearly six years.

persons.name: Tartaglione, Nicholas John
persons.context: The subject of the inmate housing history report, showing his various cell/bed assignments within federal detention facilities from 2016 to 2022.

events.title: Tartaglione enters federal custody
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione begins his incarceration as recorded in the housing history, starting in House R/Range 01/Bed 001L.

events.title: Most recent housing assignment
events.description: Tartaglione is moved to House J/Range 05/Bed 703U, which is recorded as his current assignment as of the document date.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - inferred from 'NYM' designation for New York Metropolitan
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) - inferred from housing units
House E, House G, House I, House J, House K, House R, House Z - various housing units within the facilities
keyFacts: Nicholas John Tartaglione has been in federal custody since at least December 20, 2016.
The document tracks his movements between at least 7 different housing units (E, G, I, J, K, R, Z) with numerous bed changes.
As of September 12, 2022, he was housed in House J/Range 05/Bed 703U.
The housing codes (NYM, BRO) suggest he was held in New York Metropolitan facilities, likely MCC and MDC.
The frequent bed changes indicate possible administrative moves, security concerns, or facility management protocols.
